review:
Hello!
Thanks for the feedback.

Our goal is to show that India can be different, including modern: without carved furniture, gold, copper utensils and sitar. The interior used the usual for India: tiffin and kadai pans instead of lamps, wicker furniture in the colonial style, art deco, because Mumbai is the second largest city in the world in terms of art deco architecture, and the tables are reminiscent of the Old Quarter in Panaji. And many other details.

India is different in food. Lots of regional cuisine, meat and milk, seafood, etc. As for vegetarian dishes, they (excluding vegetarian side dishes) make up 46% of our menu.
